Journal Story: Hey out there. First, a little bit about myself. I'm 46, no kids (that I know of) & not married. Been stuck in one temp job after another since graduating from Iowa State in 2001 which has left my outlook in life a little grim. Which is why I want take on such a crazy idea as hiking the entire AT. It's gonna be tough at first, as I'm definably not an athlete...but hey, it's only walking . And so after over a year of planning and working 2 jobs this past year, my start date is finally in site! First, a BIG thanks to all my friends and especially family for all your support. I've wanted to hike the AT ever since I heard about it as a kid and even though I have little to no experience backpacking, it's now or never, and I can't wait for my adventure to start.
Just got my REI dividend in the mail. Guess it's true what they say about backpacking.Spend a small fortune to live like a homeless person.
Final prep hike before I leave Easter Sunday. Weighed pack, base weight 21.5 bls. Snowed off an on last night till 11pm, with lows in the 20s. Really hope it never gets that cold in GA.
